ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

Content-Length.description: Size of the HTTP response body, in bytes.

304.description: The fingerprint of the HTTP response matches one of the ETags from the incoming If-None-Match header.

ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

get.summary: Retrieves the related game identities of an individual player's games relationship.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the player whose related game identities to retrieve.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: For syntax, see the documentation for the [`filter`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/filtering.html)/[`sort`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/sorting.html)/[`page`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/pagination.html)/[`fields`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/sparse-fieldset-selection.html) query string parameters.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: A list of ETags, resulting in HTTP status 304 without a body, if one of them matches the current fingerprint.

200.description: Successfully returns the found game identities, or an empty array if none were found.

ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

304.description: The fingerprint of the HTTP response matches one of the ETags from the incoming If-None-Match header.

ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

head.summary: Retrieves the related game identities of an individual player's games relationship without returning them.
head.description: Compare the returned ETag HTTP header with an earlier one to determine if the response has changed since it was fetched.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the player whose related game identities to retrieve.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: For syntax, see the documentation for the [`filter`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/filtering.html)/[`sort`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/sorting.html)/[`page`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/pagination.html)/[`fields`](https://www.jsonapi.net/usage/reading/sparse-fieldset-selection.html) query string parameters.

ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

Content-Length.description: Size of the HTTP response body, in bytes.

304.description: The fingerprint of the HTTP response matches one of the ETags from the incoming If-None-Match header.

ETag.description: A fingerprint of the HTTP response, which can be used in an If-None-Match header to only fetch changes.

post.summary: Adds existing games to the games relationship of an individual player.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the player to add games to.

requestBody.description: The identities of the games to add to the games relationship.

204.description: The games were successfully added, which did not result in additional changes.

400.description: The request body is missing or malformed.

409.description: A resource type in the request body is incompatible.

patch.summary: Assigns existing games to the games relationship of an individual player.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the player whose games relationship to assign.

requestBody.description: The identities of the games to assign to the games relationship, or an empty array to clear the relationship.

204.description: The games relationship was successfully updated, which did not result in additional changes.

400.description: The request body is missing or malformed.

409.description: A resource type in the request body is incompatible.

delete.summary: Removes existing games from the games relationship of an individual player.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the player to remove games from.

requestBody.description: The identities of the games to remove from the games relationship.

204.description: The games were successfully removed, which did not result in additional changes.

400.description: The request body is missing or malformed.

409.description: A resource type in the request body is incompatible.
